page.title: 09Transport - Melling area.
page.content: Melling and Arkholme are on the bus route from Lancaster to Kirkby Lonsdale although it is only a limited service. Special buses take older children to secondary schools and bring Primary children from other villages and farms. Some men go to work on buses hired by their firm. Most people have cars. There are no shops in Melling so a lady from the garage takes some elderly people, mainly ladies,to shop and to collect pensions. A new Voluntary Transport Service for emergencies has been organised by the WI.and P.Council. The railway skirts both villages but the stations were closed about 20 years ago and converted to private houses. The line goes through to Yorkshire. Melling school children watched the steam train,"Flying Scots- man"go through on its last journey.
